Description: Rim fragment of small pottery bowl (lekanis?) with black-figure decoration; inside glazed; double dot frieze on top of lip; black-figure frieze on wall, upper part of head of sphinx to right wearing 'crown' and part of wing.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Near to work of Polos painter.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 55, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2212)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: IV.4 (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
